I think you need to write the end-to-end (Customer) tests. Ultimately, that=
's what demonstrates the presence of features to the people paying for the =
software. In many cases, there will be a Programmer Test or two that tests =
your application engine in exactly the same way that your Customer Test tes=
ts your entire application. If you find this to be the case, then consider =
not writing the application engine test and instead test the low-level obje=
cts. If there is nothing in between -- if your Action objects are as low-le=
vel as you get -- then live with the duplication. Ultimately, you need to t=
est your front end through HTTP.

Take care.
